main event: Multiple UFO sightings were recorded at various locations in the 1950s, including Lowry AFB, Colo. and Philadelphia, Pennsylvania. The sightings involved ground-radar observations, as well as visual observations by trained personnel and a responsible civilian.
interesting points: The UFO observed over Lowry AFB, Colo. on Feb 22, 1959, was noted to have a vapor trail and descended slowly before disappearing from radar. No visual sighting was reported.

A responsible individual, described as having an M.S. degree and employed by the Philco Corporation, reported a UFO sighting in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania. The object was described as moving at a rapid speed, with an orange center and yellow outer portion, and no sound was noted.
Another sighting on March 2, 1959 at Lowry AFB, Colorado described an object seen through the windshield of a car, traveling at a constant speed and disappearing after three to four seconds.
A summary of the preliminary investigation of a 1957 UFO report indicated an exciting incident and was submitted by a responsible person.
A UFO sighting report from March 31, 1959, revealed a malfunction of equipment causing an echo to appear as a radar return, prompting the termination of further investigation.
result: Some sightings were unexplained while others were attributed to equipment malfunctions or indicated a need for further investigation.
sighted object: Multiple UFO sightings, including objects that descended slowly, moved rapidly, and appeared as radar echoes.
location: Lowry AFB, Colo. and Philadelphia, Pennsylvania
witnesses: Trained personnel, a responsible civilian, and a car observer
photographs: No photographs included in the reports
